cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.IR, cs.NE 

This paper is likely to belong to the arXiv CS sub-category of cs.CL (Computation and Language) because it deals with the task of automatically identifying discourse relations, which is a subfield of natural language processing. The paper also mentions the use of distributional semantics, which is a common technique in computational linguistics. 

The paper may also belong to cs.LG (Machine Learning) and cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) because it proposes a machine learning-based approach to predicting discourse relations. 

Additionally, the paper involves the use of syntactic parse trees, which suggests that it may be relevant to the sub-category of cs.IR (Information Retrieval), which often involves analyzing the structure of text. 

Finally, the paper mentions the use of coreference resolution, which is a task related to entity linking. This suggests that the paper may also be relevant to the sub-category of cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing), which includes topics such as entity recognition and linking.
